Title: Product Manager, Network and Security
RoleDescription:
Who We Are:
Wayfairs internal employee technology teams are responsible for planning, executing and handing off large, complex, cross-functional technology dedicated to serve our employees across our operations. These teams own everything from employee onboarding and continued productivity support, productivity tools, asset management and in-office experiences. The goal of this team is to solve dynamic technology needs for Wayfairians everywhere by providing them a frictionless technology support experience.
We are seeking a Senior Product Manager to drive the strategy, development, and execution of networking, security, cloud, and observability solutions. This role will focus on Zero Trust Network Access (ZTNA), application security, cloud networking, SD-WAN, cost optimization (FinOps), network observability, and CCaaS (Contact Center as a Service) solutions. The ideal candidate has experience with Genesys Cloud, Conversational AI, and FinOps, along with expertise in network security, automation, and cost-efficient infrastructure management. These technologies are used to support mission critical systems, hence requiring a person who can balance operational efficiency along with continuous improvement goals. This person will work with cross-functional teams and leaders, including operations, science teams, engineers, analysts, on capabilities needed for efficient operations while enabling technologies for reimagining our customer and supplier experiences.
What Youll Do:

Own the product strategy & roadmap
Define and drive the networking, security, FinOps, and observability product roadmap aligned with business goals.
Conduct market research, competitive analysis, and customer feedback to influence product decisions.
Identify cost-saving opportunities through network optimization, automation, and cloud cost management strategies.
Collaborate with engineering, cloud, and AI teams to integrate Conversational AI with Genesys Cloud and CCaaS.
Network Security & ZTNA
Develop and enhance Zero Trust Network Access (ZTNA) solutions for secure application access.
Define application security policies to ensure compliance with cloud security best practices.
Implement SASE (Secure Access Service Edge) and security frameworks for multi-cloud environments.
Work with security teams to mitigate threats, vulnerabilities, and attack surfaces.
Network Observability & Performance Optimization
Implement network observability tools for real-time monitoring, analytics, and incident response.
Drive adoption of AI-driven insights and automation to enhance network performance, uptime, and security.
Develop strategies to reduce network latency, improve resilience, and ensure SLAs.
Enhance monitoring with Datadog, Splunk, New Relic, and Prometheus.
FinOps & Cost Optimization
Develop and execute FinOps strategies to reduce cloud and networking costs.
Optimize cloud networking expenses, interconnectivity, and SD-WAN deployments.
Work with finance, engineering, and operations teams to implement cost-saving initiatives.
Lead automation efforts to reduce operational overhead and improve cost efficiency.
Conversational AI & CCaaS (Genesys Cloud)
Collaborate with AI teams to integrate Conversational AI with Genesys Cloud and CCaaS solutions.
Ensure scalability, security, and performance of AI-driven customer engagement platforms.
Work with contact center teams to optimize networking and infrastructure for CCaaS.
Improve observability and security in real-time AI-driven communication workflows.
Cross-Functional Collaboration & Execution
Work with engineering, security, cloud, finance, and AI teams to execute product initiatives.
Partner with marketing and sales to define go-to-market (GTM) strategies for networking and security products.
Ensure alignment between business objectives, security policies, and operational efficiency.
Present updates to executives and stakeholders, ensuring transparency and alignment.

We Are a Match Because You Have:

6+ years of product management experience in networking, security, cloud, or FinOps.
Experience with Genesys Cloud, Conversational AI, and CCaaS solutions.
Strong expertise in ZTNA, application security, network observability, and cost optimization.
Hands-on experience with cloud networking (AWS, Azure, GCP) and hybrid cloud environments.
Familiarity with FinOps, cost-saving strategies, and cloud financial governance.
Knowledge of network automation, SD-WAN, SASE, VPNs, and security frameworks.
Experience working with network monitoring tools (Datadog, Splunk, New Relic, Prometheus, etc.).
Proven ability to drive cross-functional collaboration, roadmap execution, and product innovation.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (MBA is a plus).
Experience in network security, AI-driven observability, and incident response.
Knowledge of ZTNA vendors (Zscaler, Palo Alto, Cloudflare, etc.).
Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform and Ansible.
Strong understanding of Kubernetes networking and service mesh architectures.
Experience in B2B SaaS, FinOps strategies, and AI-driven networking solutions

Title: Workforce Planner
RoleDescription:
This role is an onsite position based out of one of our Middle Mile Center in either Greensboro, NC or South Elgin, IL 
The Workforce Planner plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site(s) specific goals across Wayfair. They partner with others to ensure timely and cost efficient processing of the orders.
What You'll Do

You will create weekly and daily operating plans for site(s) and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for site plans at this cadence to align with Site leadership and network priorities.
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to short-mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
Youll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan - i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
Communicate with cross-functional leadership
Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements

What You'll Need

2+ years relevant experience in supply chain
Excellent communication skills - Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements
You must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future.

The salary range for this position is $78,660 - $89,775 however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Title: Senior Data Science Product Manager, Profitability and Forecasting Algorithms
RoleDescription:
About Wayfair
Wayfair is revolutionizing the way people shop for their homes. Were an e-commerce retailer thats transforming the online shopping experience, and were looking for passionate individuals to join our team.
About the Role
Where will we ship the next couch we sell and how much will it cost to get it there? What are the drivers of customer returns? Which of the new products launched on our site are best positioned to take off and become best sellers? How different will this picture look in the future?
Profitability and Forecasting Algorithms answers these questions and others like them. We vend cost, demand, and profit estimates globally to ensure profit-aware decision-making across the company in systems such as pricing, sort, and marketing. Our broad scope comes with regular executive visibility and the opportunity to influence critical business strategy at Wayfair.
We are looking for a highly motivated and solution-oriented Product Manager to steer the product vision and roadmap for this team. We focus on maximizing the business impact of our machine learning models through experimentation and post-hoc model evaluation. We elevate our models and their outputs through analytics products to power company-wide decision making. We are a high performing team of engineers, machine learning engineers/data scientists/economists, and product managers. 
What You'll Do:

Develop and execute a multi-year roadmap for machine learning and economics products across a suite of cost, margin, and inventory predictive algorithms
Define detailed technical product features and establish delivery timelines
Conduct in-depth analysis of customer and product behavior and share learnings with senior executives to drive pricing strategies and guide product development
Establish and monitor key metrics for pricing and cost estimation, identifying trends and driving improvements
Develop a validation framework for deploying and measuring the impact of multiple machine learning models
Collaborate with engineering, machine learning science, economics, data science analytics, and other tech teams to define system architecture and science vision
Serve as a thought partner to science, engineering, and senior business leaders, communicating insights and recommendations
Act as a subject matter expert to non-technical stakeholders and leadership

Title: Merchant Assistant
RoleDescription:
As a Merchant Assistant, you will support the Merchant team in developing, executing and driving assortment strategies for a given product category. In this role you will work closely with the Merchant Category owners to execute on the strategic vision for a category. You will support in verifying ranges that become our Wayfair Verified items (Wayfairs super set of products that capture our highest % of revenue). You will understand the category curation vision and work hands on with the product to ensure the quality, style and price point are representative of our strategy. You will influence how curated product ranges are quality checked and verified, surfacing our best items across all Wayfair marketing channels (print, digital and social), ensuring accurate product representation and appropriate shelf placement. 
 
What you'll do on any given day as a Merchant Assistant...
As a Merchant Assistant, you will be executing against our ambitious goals to shape our future curation strategy.  You will gain a deep understanding of the competitive market for your class. You will work alongside Merchants to bring the class and category vision to life on Wayfair. You will validate and audit our selected Wayfair Verified items to ensure they meet our rigorous quality standards. You will know our customers needs better than anyone else and apply your knowledge to ensure we are amplifying the correct products across the website and all marketing channels. You are working closely with senior merchants to understand the vision of what tomorrows best sellers will be to continue to surprise and delight our target market. Your success requires tenacity, agility, attention to detail, collaboration, and an excellent team spirit. 
 
What Youll Do 

Support in building and maintaining category assortment strategies, inclusive of developing a shelf space plan and actively selecting, developing and iterating on the product offering
Audit our Wayfair verified items, but checking the product against a rigorous set of quality standards
Determining if each product should be included within as Wayfair Verified item based on your findings in the audit process
Communicate the auditing results with the wider Merchants team to amplify successful items and replace unsuccessful items / product gaps. 
Partner closely with the Wayfair Verified Studio team to support with video scheduling
Collaborate with PVP Sampling Team & WH Consolidation Team to ensure the smooth running of the sampling process through to assembly and audit of item.
Identify opportunities for category growth, utilizing competitive analysis, trend research, and internal performance monitoring as data points
Maintain a close pulse on trends and customer needs to identify new assortment opportunities alongside Senior Merchant teams.  
International Travel [1-2x / year] Attend industry trade shows relevant to your categories to partner with strategic suppliers and further optimize our catalog    

 
Who You Are

A recent graduate or entry level candidate, excited to enter a merchandising career path in a fast paced ecommerce environment
Strong creative sense, elevated taste level, and love of product.  A genuine passion for industry trends, product design, and home decorating is a plus.
Work experience in buying or merchandising categories, curating assortments and developing compelling assortment presentations are all highly preferred.
Excellent communication skills and ability to influence internal stakeholders to align behind and execute against a common goal
Capable of thriving in a high-growth environment in which defining clarity amidst ambiguity and operating in scrappy start-up building mode are everyday activities. 
Self-starter motivated by the potential to define a creative and strategic vision and have an outsized impact within a team and company
Ability to work from Wayfairs Birmingham Office (Lutterworth) 5 days a week

Title: Controls Engineer
RoleDescription:
Controls/Automation Engineer

Read and Update Electrical Schematics
Create diagrams for a machine or process
Ability and willingness to travel 30% with some International travel

Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Strong communication and teamwork abilities
Willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies

Experience 2+ years in field engineering/application material handling field

Title: Manager of Paid Search Marketing
RoleDescription:
This position is a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Boston HQ. Monday-Thursday will be working in office and Friday is WFH. This is not a virtual / remote position.
Wayfair Canadas Marketing team is looking for a data-driven Manager to drive strategy and execution across our Paid Search channels (SEM, PLA). As a leader on Wayfair.cas marketing team, you will help drive growth in a fast-paced environment. You will own your roadmap, come up with creative solutions to strategic and operational problems, and manage a team of highly analytical analysts.
The Paid Search team at Wayfair.ca runs multi-million dollar campaigns to capture demand from customers shopping for our categories across search engines. We build and leverage cutting edge campaign automation and bidding solutions designed in-house to optimize our campaigns and maximize revenue. We use advanced analytics to find and optimize growth opportunities and ensure our customers find and purchase what they need across our stores. Were responsible for bidding on the right set of millions of ads, valuing willingness to pay for each, and developing creative and landing page strategies to best monetize search engine traffic. We collaborate with Data Science and Engineering to build new capabilities for the channel and rapidly iterate on new opportunities and nascent product categories. 
What You'll Do

Lead and develop a team of analysts to own, manage and grow the SEM & PLA channels for Wayfair.ca by developing processes and automation that drive measurable results, and communicating progress and performance to marketing leadership.
Work cross-functionally with Marketing Technology, Data Science, Creative, Category Management, and other teams to partner on strategies that grow the channel.
Cultivate and strengthen interpersonal relationships with vendor partners, including Google and Microsoft.
Closely monitor campaign performance daily; identify, root cause and problem solve abnormalities, and react to deviations from plan quickly and strategically.
Institute rigorous strategic planning, road mapping, and test-and-learn methodologies to set goals and achieve desired results.

What You Need: 

4+ years experience in a heavily quantitative and analytical role (in finance, data analytics or strategy field with a track record of success).
At least 1 year of leadership experience, either formal through direct management or informal through project management or mentorship, with the ability to cultivate a collaborative team culture.
Excellent analytical skills with experience using data analytics tools like SQL, R, Python.
Experience developing roadmaps and informing marketing strategies.
Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to tailor channel performance updates to the appropriate audience (senior stakeholders, peers, analysts, etc.).
Demonstrated experience effectively working with and influencing cross-functional stakeholders.
Ability to identify value and prioritize work while collaborating with multiple stakeholders with competing priorities.
Ability to independently scope ambiguous problems and execute on solutions.
An entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to thrive in a highly ambiguous and fast-paced environment with a dynamic bias for action.

Title: Labor Planning Manager
RoleDescription:
The role plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site specific goals across Wayfair's Fulfillment Network. They work to ensure the accurate, timely, and cost efficient processing of the perfect order to our customers.
What You'll Do

You will create daily operating plans for a site and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for building plans at this cadence to align with Site Director and network priorities.
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
Youll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan - i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements

What You'll Need

3+ years operational experience in distribution or manufacturing.
Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
Capacity Planning experience or Industrial Engineering background focused on operations flow and labor management
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements
You must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future

Title: Product Manager, Global Supplier Technology
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
About Wayfair:Wayfair operates the largest custom e-commerce large-parcel network in the U.S., spanning 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. As we strive to become the worlds top online destination for home goods, we empower 24 million customers with cutting-edge technology, offering access to 33 million products from 23,000 global suppliers.
Our Bengaluru delivery center plays a key role in driving speed, convenience, and cost efficiency across the value chain. Here, we collaborate with top engineers, creatives, product managers, data scientists, and analysts to build and scale world-class software solutions. If you thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth, and agile environment, this is the place for you!
The Opportunity:At Wayfair, our Global Supplier Technology team is dedicated to crafting world-class experiences that empower and delight our suppliers. We operate as small, focused, and fully resourced teams, combining the agility of a startup with the strength and scale of a leading eCommerce powerhouse.
As a Product Manager, you will play a critical role in executing the vision and strategy of our products, driving the development of scalable, high-impact solutions that elevate the supplier experience. Partnering closely with senior product managers, engineering, design, and business teams, you will lead the creation of innovative products that align with our mission and deliver significant value to both internal and external stakeholders.
What you'll do:In this role, you will work closely with multiple teams and suppliers to deeply understand supplier needs and workflows. Your focus will be on delivering capabilities across supplier entities, catalog management, advertising, pricing, inventory, and order management. The supplier platform serves as a comprehensive ecosystem, offering essential accelerants for supplier business growth, including supplier ads, business insights, and data-driven recommendations.
Capability Definition:

Prioritize capabilities that enable suppliers to onboard onto Wayfairs platform.
Create detailed requirements, user stories, and workflows to guide development teams.

Roadmap Ownership:

Maintain a clear product roadmap that aligns with business goals and supplier needs.
Balance short-term deliverables with long-term strategic initiatives.

Cross-functional Collaboration:

Partner with engineering to deliver high-quality solutions on time and within scope.
Work with supplier-facing teams to ensure smooth rollout and adoption of new features.

Stakeholder Management: 

Ensure alignment on product goals, priorities, and timelines.

Product Delivery: 

Ensure successful, timely delivery of new features and enhancements that improve compliance and operational efficiency.

Performance Monitoring:

Tack, and report on key product success metrics (KPIs) related to your product areas
Continuously iterate on solutions based on data and feedback.

Travel & International Collaboration: 

Able to travel internationally to collaborate with teams, share updates, and drive key initiatives forward.

Were a Great Fit If You:

Have 5+  years of experience in product management with a total experience of  ~8-10 years.
Are known for your accountability, organization, and ability to drive outcomes.
Excel at problem breakdown and guiding teams through structured decision-making.
Have a strong background in testing and experimentation, using insights to shape roadmaps.
Are data-driven, continuously monitoring KPIs and conducting analyses to inform decisions.
Communicate and collaborate effectively, even when making tough prioritization calls.
Take initiative to achieve meaningful goals for your team and organization.
Have experience driving scalable enterprise tech solutions across cross-functional teams.
Possess technical proficiency, with a solid understanding of software development, agile methodologies, and working with tech teams to build scalable solutions.
Demonstrate strong leadership and collaboration skills, influencing stakeholders and managing complex projects in a cross-functional setting.
Hold a Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Law, or a related field; an advanced degree or MBA is a plus.

Title: Wayfair Security Supervisor
RoleDescription:
Wayfair Security Supervisor 
Location: Cranbury, NJ 
 
We are Wayfair; we deliver a best-in-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. We are looking for a talented Asset Protection Supervisor to join our Supply Chain Asset Protection Team. This is an incredible and unique opportunity to join a rapidly growing eCommerce company and to help build a department from the ground up  your professional home awaits you at Wayfair!
 
The Wayfair Security Supervisor will be responsible for the daily security operations of Wayfair for two Cranbury locations. The position will provide support to applicable stakeholders in the event of an incident.  This individual will be part of a dynamic corporate security team whose mission is to provide world class support to our partners. The Security Supervisor will report to the Cranbury Campus Global Security Manager and advise on any developing issues.
 
What Youll Do 

Perform daily functions of the Wayfair Security Supervisor by leading a team of 21 Security Agents; including hiring, training, performance management, payroll compliance, etc.
Provide supportive feedback and coaching throughout the year to help management achieve security performance objectives. 
Lead campus security by monitoring alarms, access control, CCTV and events that may impact Wayfairs Cranbury campus operations, property and assets.
Perform duties as assigned by the Campus Global Security Manager and assist in the day to day security operations of the campus.
Plan and coordinate risk mitigation measures to threat escalations to minimize impact to Wayfairs people and operations.
Perform key duties and be the key point of contact for first responders in the event of an emergency.
Maintain detailed records of communications and events, including incident tracking and case management. 
Manage and handle sensitive incidents while maintaining the companys and affected individual's confidentiality.
Work in support of the Campus Global Security Manager in security related initiatives and investigations.
Partner cross-functionally with all levels of Supply Chain Management to resolve security and/or life safety related issues.
Maintain effective working relationships with regulatory agencies, industry security and life safety professionals, vendors, and suppliers. 
Continuously improve our business continuity plan to ensure well-organized recovery during and after a crisis.  
Enable execution of the crisis management plan and emergency response programs, ensuring security personnel, management, and employees are prepared to handle anticipated emergencies.
Ensure employees are properly trained and prepared to respond in emergency situations.
Ensure Security Agents are following documented role responsibilities. 
Work to ensure there are no gaps in Security Agents coverage.
Work with site leadership to resolve security related issues. 
Partner with operations to ensure the implementation and adherence of all aspects of our Injury and Illness Prevention Plan for assigned location(s).
Anticipate, identify, evaluate hazardous conditions and build practices to aid in all critical incident planning, preparation and responses. 
Conduct inspections of facilities to identify and correct potential safety hazards, security risks, and ensure regulatory compliance.
Partner with site leadership in developing action plans to improve safety/security culture in assigned location(s) and promote employee engagement in safety/security programs.

 
 
What Youll Need

Be an experienced professional with highest standards of trust, discipline and professionalism
2+ years of experience working in a security function
Proven ability to solve problems and make sound decisions in ambiguous and complex situations. Preferably in  security, law enforcement or military fields.
Ability to multitask in a fast-paced work environment and make sound decisions under pressure.
Familiarity with technology and ability to quickly learn new programs in access management technologies such as Lenel and cameras systems.
Proficient computer skills with familiarity in Microsoft Excel and Google Suites. 
Bachelors Degree preferred, but not required.
Must have the ability to plan, coordinate and execute complex operational requirements with cross functional internal and external teams. 
Excellent organizational, communication, and time management skills.
Ability to work in a flexible schedule environment.


Experience with scheduling and workforce management is a plus.
Demonstrated working knowledge of security and risk management, best practices, policies, programs and procedures. 
Superior communication skills with the ability to navigate a complex organization and generate buy-in for ideas and plans.
Must be able to stand and or walk in a variety of weather and terrain conditions for shifts up to 10 hours.
Must be able to lift and hold 15 pounds.
Be able to work effectively in warehouse environments with hot and cold conditions, as well as loud noises.
OSHA 10 or 30 preferred.
Ability to travel within your assigned area of responsibility. Occasional overnight travel may be required as needed.

Title: Product Manager
RoleDescription:
Who We Are
We optimize Wayfair's supply chain through innovative solutions, enabling strategic business outcomes and a seamless supplier and customer experience. We are the driving force in transforming Wayfair's supply chain into an industry-leading model of efficiency, agility, and customer-centricity.  This team focuses on large, strategic initiatives that cross many tech and ops verticals (Storefront, Supply Chain and Retail Tech, Global Supplier Technology) to define the end-to-end solutions.
We are looking for a Product Manager to lead our Automation Platform space. This product is the backbone of our integration between our warehouse management system and warehouse controls systems that provides automated sortation within our Fulfillment Centers. Title: Senior Network Automation Engineer
RoleDescription:
Who We Are
At Wayfair, our Global Network Services (GNS) team is at the forefront of modernizing and automating network infrastructure to support our rapidly scaling global operations. We leverage Infrastructure as Code (IaC), CI/CD pipelines, and cloud-native networking to ensure a secure, high-performing, and cost-efficient network environment.
As a Senior Network Automation Engineer, you will play a critical role in transforming how Wayfair designs, deploys, and manages its global network by driving automation, optimizing cloud and on-prem connectivity, and implementing scalable, resilient network architectures. This role requires deep technical expertise, a strong automation mindset, and the ability to collaborate across infrastructure, security, and cloud engineering teams.
What You'll Do
1. Network Automation & Infrastructure as Code (IaC)

Design, develop, and maintain network automation solutions using Terraform and other IaC tools.
Automate the provisioning and configuration of network devices, cloud networking components (GCP, Azure), and on-premise infrastructure.
Ensure version-controlled infrastructure with Git, maintaining reproducibility and auditability.
Build modular, reusable, and scalable Terraform modules for efficient deployment and management.

2. CI/CD Pipeline Integration for Network Deployments

Develop and implement CI/CD pipelines for network automation using GitHub Actions, GitLab CI/CD, Jenkins, or Ansible Tower.
Automate testing, validation, and deployment of network changes across environments.
Ensure network changes are staged and tested before production rollouts to minimize risk and downtime.
Collaborate with DevOps and Cloud Engineering teams to align network automation with overall infrastructure automation strategies.

3. Configuration Management & Compliance

Implement configuration management tools (e.g., Ansible) for automating and enforcing network configurations.
Ensure policy-driven network configurations to maintain security, compliance, and consistency across the global network.
Automate configuration backups, validation, and drift detection for improved reliability and troubleshooting.

4. Network Architecture & Design

Design and automate hybrid and multi-cloud network architectures, including VPCs, VNets, Transit Gateways, and SD-WAN solutions.
Implement Zero Trust Network Access (ZTNA) and secure interconnectivity between on-prem and cloud networks.
Support high-availability and fault-tolerant designs that scale with Wayfairs global operations.

5. Process Automation & Optimization

Identify and automate repetitive network tasks, including provisioning, monitoring, and remediation.
Develop self-service network automation workflows to empower teams with on-demand network management capabilities.
Use API-driven automation to integrate with monitoring and security platforms for proactive network management.
Improve operational efficiency by reducing manual intervention through scripting (Python, Go, PowerShell).

6. Monitoring, Logging, & Troubleshooting

Integrate network automation with observability platforms like Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, or Datadog.
Automate network telemetry collection, alerting, and log analysis to improve troubleshooting efficiency.
Proactively detect and mitigate network anomalies using automation-driven insights.

7. Collaboration, Documentation & Mentorship

Work closely with Network Engineers, Cloud Architects, Security teams, and DevOps to ensure seamless automation adoption.
Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for network automation workflows, Terraform modules, and CI/CD processes.
Mentor junior engineers, fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation.
Participate in cross-functional initiatives, helping Wayfair advance its digital transformation and infrastructure modernization goals.

What You'll Need

5+ years of experience in network engineering and automation, with a strong focus on Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
Expertise in Terraform, Ansible, Python, and CI/CD tools for automating network infrastructure.
Hands-on experience with cloud networking (AWS, Azure, GCP) and on-prem networking (Cisco, Palo Alto, Juniper).
Strong understanding of routing, switching, VPNs, firewalls, and SD-WAN technologies.
Experience integrating network automation with monitoring/logging platforms for proactive issue detection.
Knowledge of Zero Trust Network Access (ZTNA), cloud interconnects, and security best practices.
Experience working in Git-based version control environments and collaborating with DevOps teams.
Problem-solving mindset with a strong ability to troubleshoot complex network issues.
Certifications such as CCNP, Cloud Certified Advanced Networking, Terraform Associate, or equivalent are a plus.

Title: Bath & Kitchen Sales Assistant Store Manager - Perigold
RoleDescription:
Brief Overview of Position
Perigold, the destination for luxury home, is opening its first physical retail stores in West Palm Beach, FL, first-of-their-kind luxury retail destinations of 20-30K square feet, with the best products in all styles and from across our catalog including furniture, decor, housewares, and home improvement categories. Come be a part of it!  We are looking for an Assistant Store Manager, Sales Lead to oversee all Sales functions for the store.  This role will lead a team of in-store Designers and Product Specialists, collaborate closely with the store Guest Experience Lead, and report directly into the Store Manager.  If you are passionate about luxury and/or design, looking for rapid growth, and thrive on constant learning and dynamic challenges, this may be the perfect fit.  
 
What youll do 

Oversee all in-store sales operations including supervision of Zone Leads and Designer team, adherence to sales floor presentation standards, and in-stock replenishment needs. 
Collaborate with General Contractors on bath and kitchen design implementation in client spaces.
Understand and deliver on the compatibility of appliances within client spaces.
In collaboration with the Store Manager, establish goals for the Sales team (Zone Leads, Product Specialists and Designers) in alignment with overall business sales targets and guest experience standards.
Attract, hire, coach, and retain top-performing talent. 
In collaboration with corporate field enablement lead and in partnership with our supplier base as needed, develops and executes training curriculum and schedule to drive results in alignment with sales targets and guest experience goals. 
Analyze Sales metrics via reporting tools on a regular basis, share out to  Store Manager, and translate to training and process improvement needs for Sales team.
Communicate regularly with the Sales team on store performance and improvement needs in order deliver an exceptional luxury experience and achieve sales goals; inspire team excellence.   
Fosters a culture of collaboration across Product Specialists and Designers to ensure the store guests gets the appropriate level of support for their shopping needs and we maximize our impact on the guests home via lead generation, upselling, and design support.
Maintain close communication and collaboration with the Regional Design Manager to support guests across channels (virtual, in-store) and optimize Designer utilization.
Partner with the Store Manager and other store Leads including Logistics and Guest Experience to ensure alignment with greater business requirements and expectations (eg maintaining luxury experience standards, new season planning and execution).
Perform key holder and Manager On Duty duties.  

 
What youll need
Experience & Qualifications

3+ years of management experience, including overseeing a successful sales team.  
Demonstrated ability to recognize and maintain a high bar for luxury design.
Demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced, startup environment, including willingness to explore and test innovative ideas and pursue continuous improvement.  
Client-centric mindset.
Strong business acumen as well as exceptional analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills as it relates to managing a sales funnel.
Flexibility availability (including mornings, nights, weekends, some holidays).

Luxury home or hospitality knowledge and experience is required
Physical Requirements 

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit; regularly climb or balance; and frequently stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly, frequently or occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbs.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

Compensation starting at $60,386, which increases based on your relevant experience + substantial quarterly bonuses
Medical benefits, financial benefits, and a generous employee discount effective on day one of employment
